meanings.definition: Soft, warm fabric typically used for clothing or bedding.
meanings.sent1: I love snuggling up in my cozy flannels on a cold winter night.
meanings.sent2: She bought a set of flannels to make a new blanket for her bed.
meanings.sent3: The cat curled up on the pile of flannels and fell asleep.
meanings.sent4: The flannels felt like a hug from a warm cloud.
meanings.sent5: The flannels were so soft, they felt like a gentle touch on my skin.

meanings.definition: A pair of trousers made of flannel fabric.
meanings.sent1: He wore his favorite flannels to the lumberyard for work.
meanings.sent2: The flannels she bought were a perfect fit and kept her legs warm.
meanings.sent3: The flannels were so big on him, they looked like clown pants.
meanings.sent4: Her flannels were like a shield against the chilly wind.
meanings.sent5: The flannels had a cozy feel that made him want to wear them all day.

meanings.definition: To clean or polish with a piece of flannel.
meanings.sent1: She gently flannels the antique silver to make it shine.
meanings.sent2: He always flannels his shoes before going out to dinner.
meanings.sent3: The magician flannels the crystal ball to make it sparkle for the show.
meanings.sent4: The artist flannels the painting to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent5: The butler flannels the silverware until it gleams like new.
